content.description: Open Project—The obvious sweeping arete that starts from the lower right jug rail and traverses up and left to the apex of the shark fin.

Start on the far right end of the main face (right of the spray painted face) at a jug rail.  Find a good toe out right and low, and pop up to the next juggy tooth, mantling to a topout on the mossy scoop.
content.location: Start on the far right end of the main face of the Big Boulder.

content.description: A fun and tensiony “Hail Mary” high-step smear problem on the left side (if facing the graffitied face) of the Big Boulder.  Start by crimping on a left-facing plaque with a tricky low foot. Slap your way up the left arete, fighting the barndoor, eventually getting a blind high-step with your left foot.  Trust. The. Friction!!
content.protection: A couple of pads oughta suit ya well.
content.location: Left side (if facing the graffitied face) of the Big Boulder.

content.description: Very fun problem, with a quasi committing move at the top! The problem starts on a blocky crimp (right hand) in the center of the face and the left arete on the steep side of the Boulder with the graffiti on it. Climb straight up, and ham-hock mantle the sharkfin at the top.
content.protection: A couple of pads oughta do ya just fine.
content.location: On the biggest boulder’s graffiti-ridden face.

content.description: Big boulder tucked away in the woods.  Overhanging problems on all sides.
